title: English Language Arts: Grade 1
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: IOWA ACADEMIC STANDA RDS FOR English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

EF3BF3C8CC0D4EA184B333E47362F5C0.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, and being read to, and responding to
texts, including frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).

C4DE355D8DAB4FF2859287749F7306D3.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare,
glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing
them or by acting out the meanings.

A8823F63BEE14F4985A7745E47C3DD77.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are
cozy).

B2135F09463042EFABE2B680CFBD6C40.description:
Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a
tiger is a large cat with stripes).

E3D9BCED47C345BF852AD1C625317E3F.description:
Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories
represent.

F800C97192944BE8AF15EEA4776465FF.description:
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances
in word meanings.

6F69604834CE40A5A66775F9BD97EEC3.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks,
looked, looking).

BDF2083DCCBB4886B69167B35F76F0E0.description: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

F595BBBE04364D969E57E1667EBA9A8C.description:
Use known individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse,
lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

47DCE6F04FB94E6988BFBB5F0859B15D.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

DA1C5DE86BFF432D8BBFA5CDFE036EF1.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

BFDDF16C5DF7483EB0DA725A25EA59B9.description:
Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring
irregular words.

F0045919F9AE48A3B5EA1C474E1BF384.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

FB4C18CE00A4430F878CAA71891E4D6F.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

B8B997EB83C542D28BF9C7072F251FDF.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

28790CD52EF649068B7E71EB87EB364C.description:
Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and
exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.

1D4F298FBE5B414EB3B114CD0DC80176.description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

358D2F1373B2494981B97D83C7449731.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

320B8E627E904424886ECDAABB4E9E4C.description:
Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today
I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

A57AE3053B9A46D7A4A765B46AB795AE.description:
Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their; anyone,
everything).

E7F6D7B837A349DA833A1E23177E53AC.description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).

EBEC20EC8CC348CFA12D879B52246B62.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

59B2D076FC654AD09A28DAAC28B887AC.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

831A6EFEA9C146B6BBC5DABCD443ECEB.description:
Speak audibly and in complete sentences when retelling familiar stories or reciting poems, nursery
rhymes or lines of a play. (See grade 1 Language standard 1 for specific expectations.)

F061BEF84FE348638CED384A845FABCE.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and
feelings.

5B3D0C1DE8C04C038AFFFEC17058B731.description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

297348EC56404AF9995AB55AFD8D9C23.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify
something that is not understood.

CB05946745944E409FCD12D6EBCDAF12.description:
Ask and answer questions about the main topic and key details in a text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other media.

B775CFF254CF469283E43458D27848EE.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

6CFF01E349024200A5FE8815B34EA3F3.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple
exchanges.

D161303ABF3F4FB589A8C004691DD2D8.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others, staying on topic, and taking
turns speaking).

DACE996180BA4EA783342760C01A837D.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with peers and adults about grade 1 topics and texts in both
small and larger groups.

9F7821AFDEE94733B367D925F8476BF1.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from
provided sources to answer a question.

8F7AC724AE5F482788DD5463BAAFB3D7.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of “how-to” books on a given
topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

730E665BE0EB4D5EA1B47375AF808BBC.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

52CDF2FFEC614390B9B1123D5CA04FF5.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing,
including in collaboration with peers.

AE38D62F277C4724894DD38D82FB316B.description:
With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from
peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

AB0ED0AEA4504DA5AD807C71BDA9F8F9.description:
Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some
details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of
closure.

104D0AFCE3B44595874469E7C2EA31A1.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and
provide some sense of closure.

9E44A6EF555944009C9287DF64DD64BE.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an
opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

A2811D93139148909479F9EF801B9A90.description: Produce manuscript writing with accuracy and automaticity.

D588E48BF1EA4C12807EFE2F96453EF3.description:
Form upper and lowercase manuscript letters and numerals correctly with proportion, line
awareness, and spacing (between words and letters).

C557AE2D37E349A181A3B053F5106EB9.description: Print independently and legibly for a variety of tasks and purposes.

1ECB040482EB4B49BF8A7DB4361C6FC6.description:
Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive
readings.

B9BE3F64242B4D2FA0FA488179C60EAA.description: Use decoding skills to self-correct word recognition, rereading as necessary.

EF1BB9E5FDFF4F9E8A4B0E0F7D2ED9B6.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

65EEBA7978654F4A843D6F8FA1EF1D7C.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

C1890AD47D904BEC951B9ECB8C79CB32.description:
Read grade-appropriate high frequency words with accuracy and automaticity. (RF.1.3) (DOK
1,2)

BCCA5BC985AC4CD2B10FBDE89742B4DC.description:
With prompting and support, decode and encode words with inflectional suffixes (e.g., -ed, -ing,
-s/es, -er).

65D5C53637664B36BBFAF91ACF4DEAA7.description:
Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables (may
include closed and open syllables).

E4EEA3DAA211431197301C8FA457E265.description:
Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of
syllables in a printed word.

95A5FD0289CF4C129CB0D9EE536B9590.description:
Decode and encode regularly spelled one-syllable words with final-e (VCe) patterns. Decode
regularly spelled one-syllable words with common vowel team patterns that represent long
vowel sounds.

6F6044BEDAE74B96A0BFF99273D682B1.description:
Decode and encode regularly spelled one-syllable words with closed syllables and consonant
blends.

7DC45CE417704463AD5C664DED612D62.description: Decode and encode one-syllable words with common consonant digraphs.

F05B80D6A7614ABDA5AB825073B4201B.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics, which includes word analysis skills to support decoding and
encoding words.

7D0F7EC481034876ADE4C847250FBE18.description:
Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual phonemes
(sounds).

D41AD03E584540128E37096D54DBE302.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final phonemes (sounds) in spoken singlesyllable words.

106CE4F066DD4F57B96D34E78A92E8E4.description:
Orally produce single-syllable words by blending phonemes (sounds), including consonant
blends.

721FEF7B091B4E31BDA7DBDE619C0E2A.description: Distinguish long from short vowel phonemes (sounds) in single-syllable words.

C56E7445126B407A825AF9AB5F83EB6D.description: Demonstrate the ability to identify and manipulate individual sounds in spoken words.

5BE40D306D9E4E3B89E5DC3DA64E10DB.description:
Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending
punctuation).

803F7EE6F41B46FD8EA173518994E4D2.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

3DA9241C790E4C26B37E1DD32D15537F.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

3FE18478A3BA4BE38514D9107F3C66D9.description: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

C9D512574F124D46890CB9255081B5DE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A3D795D362A7471F95FC7A236AAFEB8E.description:
Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations,
descriptions, or procedures).

43BB5FA1CA09410CBF6C3A6BFFFF8585.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

C6A9E680018D4698A18D43F9FB6676EF.description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

6A2187B9DE7A4B1FA0D2E9D0882A2CE3.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by
the words in a text.

D5087FA924FA4F11934DD362C088C8A5.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus,
icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

8A8BA5A996144880AEB3E01ADB26AEE4.description: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

BA5E881A7F7E43EB8EFF56493D95EF35.description: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

F06578E79204452C894760E3C835C9E6.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

A488EC7091794A6187BB855C8C970511.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

16B74A6B710149908855F67A1BC64EBF.description: With prompting and support, read stories and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

F8CF8A3FD1FB4606B27B3BE8AE1293BB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

72F781DEFB984CE88A7350E967215315.description: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

E33F86479533447A89016739D94C9CED.description: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

A63D1ECB32FC474AB41669EE4F7D9D1D.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

6B1108CA3181462791EAC5370DA126D8.description:
Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a
wide reading of a range of text types.

18578DF6CE344FCFBBC178E8C2A52FC6.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

AE871BFE14A94C3983AE8A95809D80A5.description: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

8782640377A441358C8AB4B1BA06A3D3.description: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

26523DE155FD42FD9FBD6DD4A867A481.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
